content: I'm going to make a breaking change to the IG publisher. Can you all make sure that your IG's are fully checked in please
@ Bryn - I still can't build QI-Core
same error - missing file _includes.header.html. It's not committed, so I assume you need to commit it

all: I am about to commit a change where the IG publisher no longer allows you to accidentally generate the same file more than once. A couple of IGs had problems where different content was being generated to the same file due to reuse of names
I have fixed all the existing IGs
note to implementers: at the end of the IG build, you'll see a line in the log like this:
0 pages invalid xhtml, 49 broken links
FMG QA criteria will require both those numbers to be 0 for publishing

note that the 'invalid xhtml' is a requirement that all the produced html pages be well formed XML - that is, elements must be closed. The technical requirements associated with xml (namespace, DTD declaration) do not matter

A clarification: The implementation guide resource can list one or more generated pages. In the old IG publisher, the IG resource had to list every page. Not now - the IG publisher basically doesn't generate pages (unless you tell it to via templates).
there is no need to list pages in the Implementation Guide resource *for publishing purposes*

if you list pages in the Implementation Guide resource, that is for publishing purposes - because it makes sense for a tool that is e.g. validating against the implemnentation guide - to be able to refer the user to the correct page
